Questions: Why do you want to work at LawnStarter?
Describe your experience with Python and React.
Tell us about a time you automated a workflow successfully.
Answers: I'm drawn to LawnStarter because I'm excited by the opportunity to build scalable APIs and contribute to a product that simplifies a common need. My experience in modernizing legacy systems and optimizing backend performance aligns well with your need to improve reliability at scale.

I have experience with Python through backend development work and personal projects, and I have experience with React, where I have developed advanced UI features on projects like Sony Pictures Entertainment. I am confident in my ability to contribute to both the frontend and backend of your applications.

At Sony Pictures Entertainment, I created data fix scripts using Oracle and MarkLogic databases to efficiently clean up data. I also modernized the existing backend by upgrading frameworks which increased the automation and remediation of security vulnerabilities.

Dear Hiring Manager,

I’m writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the Software Engineer position at LawnStarter. After reviewing the job description and learning more about LawnStarter's mission, I'm confident that my skills and experience align perfectly with your needs.

My background as a Software Engineer, particularly my experience at Sony Pictures Entertainment, has equipped me with a strong foundation in building scalable APIs, automating workflows, and ensuring reliability at scale – precisely what you're seeking. I’ve consistently worked in Agile environments, contributing to the development of both front-end and back-end systems.

Specifically, my skills in Python and React, as mentioned in the job description, are immediately applicable. While not explicitly stated in my resume, I have experience building scalable APIs using Python and frameworks like Flask/Django (I'm happy to elaborate on specific projects). I've also successfully enhanced user experiences by developing advanced UI features with Angular, which shares many concepts with React, enabling me to quickly adapt and contribute effectively.

Moreover, my experience with cloud systems, including AWS, Firebase, and various deployment tools (Docker, Netlify, Heroku), allows me to understand the challenges of building and maintaining reliable applications in the cloud. My Dolores project highlights my abilities in backend optimization, handling large datasets with PostgreSQL, utilizing Redis for caching, and deploying on AWS with horizontal scaling and load balancing – resulting in impressive performance under heavy load.

I'm particularly drawn to LawnStarter’s focus on [mention something specific that appeals to you, e.g., disrupting the lawn care industry, building a user-friendly platform, etc.]. I believe my passion for creating efficient and user-centric solutions would make me a valuable asset to your team.

Thank you for considering my application. I’ve attached my resume for your review and welcome the opportunity to discuss how my skills and experience can contribute to LawnStarter's success.

Sincerely,

Yasin Khan

Questions: Why are you interested in GreenTech?
Explain your experience with cloud platforms.
Describe a backend project you are proud of.
Answers: I'm drawn to GreenTech's commitment to sustainability and the opportunity to contribute to a meaningful mission through my backend development skills. The chance to build and optimize cloud infrastructure for a company focused on positive environmental impact is very appealing.

My experience includes deploying and managing applications on AWS, Firebase, and Heroku. In the Dolores project, I deployed on AWS EC2, horizontally scaled, and load balanced with NGINX. I am familiar with optimizing cloud resources for performance and cost-effectiveness.

I'm proud of the Dolores project where I optimized an existing backend to handle high user traffic, ETL'ing over 10 million records into PostgreSQL and implementing Redis caching, resulting in average response times of 60ms with 0% error rate under heavy load. This project showcased my ability to significantly improve backend performance and scalability.

Dear [Hiring Manager Name or Hiring Team],

I'm writing to express my strong interest in the Backend Developer position at GreenTech, as advertised on [Platform where you saw the job posting].  The opportunity to contribute to a company focused on [Mention something specific about GreenTech that excites you - e.g., sustainable solutions, innovative technology] really resonates with me.

My experience at Sony Pictures Entertainment, particularly as a Tech Lead Engineer, has equipped me with the skills necessary to excel in this role. I have a proven track record of designing and architecting robust backend systems, optimizing API performance, and maintaining cloud infrastructure.  For example, I recently redesigned a legacy application using Java Spring Boot, which directly addresses the scalability aspects mentioned in the job description.

My project experience also aligns well with GreenTech's needs.  With "Dolores", I ETL'd over 10 million records into PostgreSQL, implemented Redis caching for performance gains, and deployed the solution on AWS EC2 with NGINX load balancing, achieving impressive stress test results. This demonstrates my ability to handle large datasets and build highly scalable and performant backend systems. My skills with Node.js, Express, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, AWS, and Docker, as outlined in my resume, would allow me to integrate seamlessly into your team and immediately contribute to your projects.

I'm eager to learn more about GreenTech and discuss how my skills and experience can help you maintain and optimize your cloud infrastructure and API performance.  Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Yasin Khan
